New York International
Children's Film Fest Presents



Aardman Animations Retrospective

Sunday, November 7 at 11 AM
Cost $3 | FREE for Hartford public school students
Recommended for ages 6 to adult.

A collection of award-winning animated short films that encompasses 25 years of creative output from claymation geniuses at Aardman Animations. Bring the kids for animated, live action and experimental shorts and features from around the world.

Aardman has a deserveded reputation as a world leader in model animation. Their award-winning work leads the field producing a unique brand of independent film.The studio has had seven Oscar nominations, and has won four.

Chicken Run was Aardman's first full-length theatrical feature film to be funded by DreamWorks. Directed by both Peter Lord and Nick Park it was released in June 2000 in the US and UK to excellent reviews and outstanding box office receipts. Chicken Run grossed over $220M at the worldwide box office.

Aardman's television series, Shaun the Sheep debuted on BBC1 and CBBC in March 2007. Inspired by Nick Park's 1995 Academy Award winning short film A Close Shave, the series has been sold worldwide. Also in 2007 Aardman produced a US version of Creature Comforts.
